title: How travel insurance comes handy on a holiday
text:
Suresh Sugathan
In our busy work schedules and hectic lives, it often becomes difficult to maintain a healthy work-life balance. Quite often than not, we see ourselves so occupied with work that we miss out on spending quality time with family and loved ones. In such times, a long weekend comes as a blessing. Whether you are a busy professional or an incessantly working homemaker, you can utilise a much-needed break for relaxation and rejuvenation. You can utilise the extended weekend for visiting some of the less explored getaways in the country. Or, you can go on a shopping and leisure trip in some Asian or South East Asian countries. With a little deeper pockets and earned leaves on hand, you could also explore this opportunity to visit picturesque destinations abroad. A lot of planning goes into ensuring that your holidays are memorable, happy and safe. From fixing travel dates to finding the best deals on hotels and airlines, from creating an itinerary to getting your visa and arranging for forex - the list is long. Every detail is ticked off with military precision to avoid unexpected glitches. However, not many think about a travel insurance plan to secure their trip as a part of their checklist. Imagine landing in Sydney to kick start your Australian adventure and your airline informs you that your baggage is missing or trying out an exotic seafood dish in a New York restaurant only to land up in a hospital at the mercy of the expensive American healthcare system. Or worse, a cyclone on the coast of Indonesia costing you your trip to Bali. Such unexpected incidences would not only hamper the holiday spirit, but could also leave a dent on the expenses made for the travel plan. Here, travel insurance would come handy. A quick look at our claims data is enough to show us that most common issues faced by Indian travellers are medical and accidental emergencies, trip delays, trip cancellations, loss of baggage and passport. For all the unwelcome troubles that you may face while getting away for a while on a holiday, you would be relieved to know that all of these are covered under travel insurance policies. Medical emergencies and Personal Accident Medical emergencies in foreign countries result in expensive treatment. Moreover, limited forex in an unfamiliar territory would weigh down heavily on your pocket and mind. Travel insurance covers hospitalisation expenses due to unexpected medical emergencies, illness or accidents when abroad. Trip delay/cancellation
Sometimes, you might need to cancel or cut short a trip due to an emergency. The monetary loss due to cancellation of bookings is covered in a travel insurance which would surely bring in some respite. This is a cover included in most of the travel insurance policies. Loss/delay in baggage
Imagine landing at the airport all excited about exploring the place. You wait to pick up your baggage only to learn from your airline that it has been lost in transit. At this point of time, shopping for essentials becomes a must as recovering your lost luggage may take anything from a few hours to a few days. Your travel insurance reimburses you this cost since most of the insurers provide a standard limit as compensation in their policy. However, please note that such loss or delay of baggage claim is admissible only if the destination is not the country of residence of the insured. Loss of passport
Losing your passport in a foreign country can be a nightmare. In the face of such a situation, you will need to procure another passport at your own expense, which is then reimbursed by your travel insurer. It, is, however, essential that the loss be reported to the appropriate police authorities within 24 hours. Today, a lot of travel plans are available that cover you against incidents the moment you step out of your home for the holiday. These plans also provide cover for burglary while you are away on vacation. Since the premium of travel policies constitute a small component of your total related expenditure, it will never add an extra burden to your budget. So if you happen to twist your ankle while paddling through the streets of Singapore or lose you baggage while in transit to Kuala Lumpur, don't panic as your travel insurance will take care of it. Tie up all the loose ends and be on the way for a wonderful and safe holiday. The author is Head-Health and Travel Insurance, Bajaj Allianz General Insurance. The views expressed in this article are his own
